Aric Chokey

Journalist and web developer

About

Lately, I've been hacking content as a web intern at the Pulitzer Prize-winning Tampa Bay Times and fresh off of the editorial team of the award-winning Ball State Daily News. While there I've helped carry the news section through our newspaper's digital-first transition as news editor.


Intrinsically, I'm a creator whether that be of copy or code. During my gigs at newspapers, I've worn a few hats doing web producing, copy editing, news editing, beat and graphic reporting and social media management. I've also spent some time at a startup and the Indiana Senate's communications office producing promotional content and growth hacking.


I've also just finished my undergraduate degree from Ball State's multimedia journalism program. I spent four years in the program learning how to leverage digital tools to best tell a story.


I spend a lot of time reading about trends in web publishing, product management, UX design and front-end methodologies. I usually tweet a lot of the ideas I come across, so connect with me on Twitter and see which ideas I'm tossing around.


Writing

  • Student government VP resigns

    A student resigned after being hospitalized and diagnosed with depression. It won a first-place Columbia Gold Circle award for "Best Breaking News."

    View story
  • Obama visits Indiana

    On a last-minute trip, I drove to southern Indiana to catch the president's visit for National Manufacturing Day and localized it to Ball State.

    View story
  • Sunday alcohol sales

    Indiana legislators weighed legalizing the sales, so I explored the lobbying behind the fight.

    View story
  • Explainer: Proposed legislation

    This is a breakdown of bills proposed by Indiana's lawmakers and what they mean.

    View story
  • Faculty member resigns

    The director of student life quit after she made oppressive comments to minority student groups.

    View story
  • Village Promenade

    A developer released plans for a $15 million multiuse project near campus.

    View story
  • Ferguson Q&A

    Students went to Ferguson, Missouri to shoot a documentary about the Michael Brown protests, so asked them about their experience.

    View story
  • Indiana's budget

    I analyzed the state budget to discover it included the first fund increase for Ball State since the recession.

    View story

Web work

  • Parallax map

    An editor at the Tampa Bay Times rode his bike down all of Florida. I helped optimize a print map of the journey for web, designed the story layout and hooked up a JavaScript parallax effect to animate an SVG path.

    View story
  • Ball State's new president

    I wrote a feature story and included a StoryMapJS ahead of the new chief's State of the University address.

    View story
  • Courts website

    I built a tumblr template for a circuit court system to house its self-litigation resources and news releases. A team and I spent a semester getting to know the goals and needs of the judges in order to design the architecture of information.

    View site

Data Projects

  • Natural amenities choropleths

    For the Tampa Bay Times, I designed and coded two interactive D3 maps to show how Florida counties rank for best scenery and climate according to data released by the USDA.

    View maps
  • U.S. GDP growth

    I built a JavaScript-based chart for the Tampa Bay Times to supplement a stoey about GDP growth.

    View graphic
  • Indiana median income

    A D3 chart showcasing the change in median income in Indiana.

    View graphic
  • U.S. job growth

    Also for the Tampa Bay Times, this JavaScript chart uses ChartistJS to show U.S. job growth.

    View graphic
  • Constituent surveys

    During my time at the Indiana Senate, I compiled results from voter surveys into graphic reports that went directly to state senators.

    View reports
  • Employment analysis

    As part of a special project for a state senator, I researched job growth in his district, visualized it and then developed talking points for him based on different angle of the data. I then repackaged the research to create a press release.

    View study
